node.title: Australia was planning to phase out caged eggs by 2036, but one state is threatening to derail that
node.alt: Eggs on a conveyor belt passing below chooks in cages.
node.description: Australia's long-awaited plan to phase out battery hens may be inÂ doubt because of a so-called "captain's call" by a state minister, documents obtained under FOI laws reveal.
node.content:
["Australia's long-awaited plan to phase out battery hens may be in\u00a0doubt because of a so-called \"captain's call\" by a state minister.", "Documents obtained under Freedom of Information laws show the NSW Agriculture Minister, Nationals MP Adam Marshall, going against the advice of his department and opposing plans to phase out the wire cages by 2036.", "The documents, obtained by legal firm K&R Animal Law, show Mr Marshall overturned recommendations from NSW Department of Primary Industries' staff, and major proposals for reform were struck out.", "A key line that has been struck out reads:\u00a0\"NSW supports a 10-year phase out of conventional cages for layer and breeder hens.\"", "Further signed documents submitted to a meeting of Australian agriculture ministers\u00a0go on to show the minister explicitly stating he would not support new welfare standards,\u00a0before he had even seen them.", "\"NSW awaits the proposed guidelines, but indicates it will NOT support a phase out of conventional cages,\" Mr Marshall wrote in a briefing note dated March 29.", "Despite this, a spokesman for Mr Marshall told the ABC last week that \"no decision has yet been made\"\u00a0on the issue.", "
Concerns over possible delay to egg reform
", "RSPCA chief scientist Bidda Jones said the documents clearly indicated a \"captain's call\" from Mr\u00a0Marshall.", "\"He's ignoring the [department's] advice,\" Dr Jones said.", "Under a national process to set new hen welfare standards, all states and territories need to agree on uniform regulation in order to create a level playing field for producers.", "If NSW does not support phasing out caged eggs by 2036, it could derail this process.", "The documents have also sparked concerns that Australia's position on hen welfare could make the country a global outlier.", "An animal law expert has warned it could threaten trade deals in the UK and EU, where the cages have long been banned.", "
Egg industry wants to allow battery cages until 2046
", "NSW is the largest producer of caged eggs in the country, and a key industry representative,\u00a0Bede Burke, is also a senior member of the NSW National Party.", "Mr Burke is the chair of Egg Farmers of Australia and holds a senior position in the NSW National Party as its official immediate past chairman, which gives him a seat on its Central Council, which ratifies pre-selections.", "", "
Bede Burke is a cage egg farmer who holds a senior position in the NSW National Party.(ABC Rural: Lara Webster, File photo)
", "Mr Burke is one of the few farmers in Australia who produce caged eggs exclusively, with most other large providers having diversified into a mix of barn-laid, free range and caged systems.", "The Tamworth-based farmer was NSW National Party chair from 2014\u00a0and held the position when Adam Marshall, a member for the neighbouring seat of Northern Tablelands, was chosen to be Agriculture Minister in 2019.", "Ministers are typically selected by the deputy premier, but the party chair and director are understood to be influential in the decision.", "Last month, during a NSW cabinet reshuffle, Mr Burke was quoted in a local newspaper expressing his support for Mr Marshall and saying he wanted him to keep the agriculture portfolio.", "\"We've got a lot of things in our industries that are happening in the ag space at the moment. We've been dealing with Adam,\" he told the Northern Daily Leader.", "\"We know how he thinks and what his vision is for it. You don't want to see change too quickly.\"", "", "
Many major food brands are moving away from using cage eggs.(Supplied: Sunny Queen)
", "Mr Burke told the ABC he had no role in Adam Marshall getting pre-selected for the seat of Northern Tablelands because he was a member of the Tamworth branch and unable to directly participate in Mr Marshall's initial preselection.", "He did not respond to questions about whether he supported Adam Marshall's subsequent cabinet appointment and whether that had influenced Mr Marshall's stance on caged eggs.", "\"Egg Farmers of Australia is an apolitical organisation which seeks to have good working relationships with all decision makers,\" he said.", "He said the industry position was to advocate for conventional cages, otherwise known as battery cages, to be used until 2046 to enable industry to transition to new hen housing infrastructure.", "
Major food brands turning away from caged eggs
", "Dr Jones said a plan to phase out battery cages was long overdue and Australia was lagging behind the rest of the developed world.", "\"We know from a whole lot of research over decades now that hens will suffer intensely and continuously in a barren battery cage because they can't move around freely, they can't perform important behaviours,\" she said.", "", "
Bidda Jones says the RSPCA is\u00a0concerned about the industry's influence on the NSW government.(ABC News: Nick Haggarty)
", "Dr Jones said her organisation was concerned by the revelations in the FOI documents.", "\"The RSPCA is really concerned about the level of influence that the cage egg industry has on the decision-making process in New South Wales,\" she said.", "The decision comes as major producers such as Sunny Queen move to diversify their operations to a mix of barn-laid, cage and free range eggs.", "Major food brands, including Latina Fresh, Masterfoods, Mars, McCain, Nestle, TipTop, Kraft, Kellogg's and Woolworths, have all committed to use only cage-free eggs by 2025.", "", "
The Coffee Club's Teegan Josselyn says the company is\u00a0moving away from cage eggs.(ABC News: Dean Cato)
", "The Coffee Club is one of the many commercial users that have moved away from caged eggs.", "The cafe chain's\u00a0Teegan Josselyn said it was part of a broad move to support sustainable farming practices.", "\"We've recently been working on our 2025 sustainability plan, which includes sourcing more responsibly-farmed ingredients and becoming transparent with our customers about where their food comes from,\" she said.", "
Trade deal 'opportunities could be lost'
", "University of Melbourne animal law and policy expert Christine Parker said the failure to get rid of battery cages was threatening Australia's trade deals with the UK and EU, which have\u00a0higher animal welfare standards.", "\"Any products that are coming into the EU have to meet the higher animal welfare standards that the EU has, and in particular battery cages,\" Professor Parker said.", "\"The UK is doing the same thing.", "\"We need to have that as a minimum standard to support these trade deals, otherwise those opportunities could be lost.\"", "", "
Christine Parker says the delay in phasing out battery hens could hurt Australia's reputation.(ABC News: Patrick Stone)
", "International farming group Compassion in World Farming has added to the concerns, warning Australia could become an outlier in the developed world if it fails\u00a0to speed up its switch away from battery hen cages.", "It said in previous deals the EU had retained tariffs on caged eggs, but looked set to refuse them outright in the future.", "\"In either case, Australian battery cage eggs would likely become uncompetitive in the European market \u2014 or be outright banned,\" a spokesperson said in a statement.", "NSW was initially given responsibility for running the hen welfare standards process, but in 2017 the ABC published documents suggesting the NSW Department of Primary Industries colluded with the chicken industry to stifle attempts at a phase-out\u00a0\u2014\u00a0something the government and industry denied.", "Professor Parker said the stalemate was also creating a broader reputational risk for Australia globally.", "\"It looks like Australia doesn't care as much about animal welfare because we just haven't done the basic thing that everybody's talking about, which is get hens out of cages,\" she said.", "In a statement, NSW Agriculture Minister Adam Marshall said NSW continued to participate in the national reform process.", "He did not respond when asked whether Bede Burke\u00a0had supported his appointment to cabinet, or whether Mr Burke's support had influenced his stance on caged eggs.\u00a0", "\"An independent panel has been tasked with developing the draft standards and guidelines,\" he said in a statement.", "\"Once this work is finalised and presented to state and territory governments, NSW will give consideration to the draft Standards and Guidelines for Poultry along with a regulation impact statement.", "\"No decision has yet been made.\""]
